review: My Chromecast arrived and worked well for about a week. Now, however, none of the videos on YouTube seem to be playable. There's an error message "This video is not available for remote playback." Videos that played fine yesterday now do not play at all to a Chromecast device. In other words, Google / YouTube have made some change that makes the Chromecast a worthless piece of plastic and metal. So I'm returning that piece of plastic and metal. Thanks, Google, for another flawed user experience!

review: I purchased this because current laptop does not have an HDMI port. The marketing by Google claims that you can cast the content being played in the chrome browser to your TV, but this results in an unwatchable choppy lagged out video. I get netflix and all of the other apps on my xbox, so this device is completely worthless to me since I can't stream online content as they claim. I even reduced the quality to the lowest setting and it still can not handle the video. I wish I could give this zero stars!

author: Edward F. Avila

review: This device is not perfect, but for $35, I'd say it's pretty good. Here are my issues with it:After watching a few episodes of 24 on Netflix, it starts going slow every now and then, the video will be in slow motion and the audio doesn't match. This may be due to the device becoming too hot, since the first hour or two is usually fine. Although this could possibly be a Netflix issue rather than a device issue. My wi-fi is pretty fast and have had no problems watching Netflix on my laptop.Also, be aware that if your TV doesn't have a USB port then you will have to plug in Chromecast to an electrical outlet.This device advertises that you can stream anything from your Google Chrome internet browser, but the few videos I've tried have been choppy and unwatchable.So overall, I like the device, and it works great for HBO Go, Netflix (except for the aforementioned lag), Pandora, and YouTube; not so good if you want to stream any video directly from your Chrome browser. It's easy to use, and if you have a USB port on your TV, it can just hide behind the TV without anyone knowing it's there.
